title: John F. Dockweiler
text:
John Francis Dockweiler (September 19, 1895 – January 31, 1943) was an American lawyer and politician who served three terms as a <a href="United%20States%20House%20of%20Representatives">U.S. Representative</a> from <a href="California">California</a> from 1933 to 1939. He also served as the <a href="District%20Attorney%20of%20Los%20Angeles%20County">District Attorney of Los Angeles County</a> from 1940-1943.
Biography.
John Francis Dockweiler was born in Los Angeles to <a href="Isidore%20B.%20Dockweiler">Isidore Bernard Dockweiler</a> and Gertrude Reeve. As a youth, he tried his hand at acting and theatrical pursuits, but his career never gained momentum. Dockweiler attended parochial schools. He graduated from Loyola College, Los Angeles in 1918 and from the <a href="University%20of%20Southern%20California">University of Southern California</a>, Los Angeles in 1921. He attended the law department of <a href="Harvard%20University">Harvard University</a>. He was <a href="Admission%20to%20the%20bar%20in%20the%20United%20States">admitted to the bar</a> in 1921, and commenced law practice in Los Angeles in 1922.
Congress.
Dockweiler was elected as a <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Democrat</a> to the <a href="73rd%20United%20States%20Congress">Seventy-third</a>, <a href="74th%20United%20States%20Congress">Seventy-fourth</a>, and <a href="75th%20United%20States%20Congress">Seventy-fifth</a> Congresses (March 4, 1933 – January 3, 1939). He was not a candidate for renomination in the primaries in 1938, but was an unsuccessful candidate for nomination as <a href="Governor%20of%20California">Governor of California</a>. In the general election, he was an unsuccessful Independent candidate for reelection to the <a href="76th%20United%20States%20Congress">Seventy-sixth</a> Congress.
Later career and death.
He resumed the practice of law. He served as district attorney of Los Angeles County 1940-1943.
He died of pneumonia in Los Angeles, California, on January 31, 1943. He was interred in <a href="Calvary%20Cemetery%2C%20East%20Los%20Angeles">Calvary Cemetery</a> (New Calvary Catholic Cemetery) in East Los Angeles.
